lexUnit.name: buzz.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have an air of excitement or purposeful activity.

sentence.text: Today the control room which has been buzzing with activity for the past fortnight is empty , most travellers have now left the area .
The restaurant was less than half-full and yet as soon as Jen had invaded it , the place buzzed with crowded special excitement .
The place is buzzing with gossip , so it 's an ideal opportunity .
One store boss said : ` The place is buzzing .
She noticed Diana 's uncertainty and , ignoring the other guests who were still buzzing over Diana 's choice of dress , whisked her off to the powder room .
The place is buzzing with fashion ideas .
More amazing is the fact that these towns do n't have the benefit of City of Culture-style licensing laws , yet are still buzzing .
With the Italian press still buzzing with the story of the Grand Canal assault , Denis Law 's brother Joe arrived for a short holiday from Aberdeen .
By 9.30am the campsite was buzzing with anticipation as everyone made sure that their equipment was working .
Northwich was buzzing with news of the fire yesterday and many were speculating as to whether ICI would bother reopening the plant , which is scheduled to close this year .
On a Monday morning , early in 1921 , Salisbury was buzzing with the news of the murder of a local taxi-driver .
A busy , scruffy town , buzzing with activity at the end of the ancient canal which separates Levkas Island from the mainland .
In a class buzzing with activity a child with severely defective vision can get left behind or left out because he can not see clearly how to perform the tasks involved .
The bar was busy when we entered , buzzing with agricultural talk , but the moment we appeared , there was total silence .
The room immediately buzzed with activity as we all scribbled down voluminous notes .
WESTMINSTER was today buzzing with anticipation as MPs gathered for tonight 's crucial vote on the Maastricht Treaty .
That afternoon the convener communicated his version of the story to the shop steward 's committee and within an hour every department was buzzing with the news .
` The town is buzzing and it will be great to be involved in first-team football again .
Hong Kong buzzes from dawn to dusk at a dizzy pace .
` The dressing room was buzzing when we came off .
